date: stated on September 15, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: The viral image of Trump is supposed to be Palatse on Fox.
text: Recently, allegations were posted on Facebook that President Donald Trump went "Balista" in a telephone interview with the morning news program Fox and Friends. The article shows a picture of Trump, in addition to his supposed statement taken to look like a footage of Fox News: "Democracy can summon me and my administration over the next 10, 15 or 20 years, and we will never give up. They must face the fact that I am responsible, this is my country and I will do whatever I please, they have no control over me. The people support me, and they always support me. President Trump shoots Fox and Felix. But that didn't really happen. The article was referred to as part of Facebook efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) The distinguished fact-finding bloggers mentioned on January 10, 2021 in the story of "The Rebel Law - General Flynn will be appointed Vice-President." By Samantha Buterman - January 11, 2012, photographs were taken. We found no example of Trump making such a statement in our search for the news archives. The drawings of the Fox screen came from a telephone interview of April 25, 2019, which Trump gave to Fox News host Shawn Hanneti when he was talking about hacking into the National Democratic Commission server 2016. The video lined up with Facebook after a 10-minute sign with a real Fox address saying, "Tromp: I want to see what was on the DNA server." The line used by Fox News Canel does not match the line "Tromp go bistic" in Facebook. A spokesman for Fox News confirmed to Bolivi Fuckett that the picture of the article had been turned.
